pr_title: Samza-2478: Add new metrics to track key and value size of records written to RocksDb

timeline.message: Add record key value size histogram metric

timeline.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add comments to describe what this test is doing?
timeline.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe add javadocs to explain how this works, the histogram stores counts for each percentile range?
and the count for each range is emitted as a gauge?
timeline.author: rmatharu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,6 +35,10 @@ class SerializedKeyValueStoreMetrics(
   val bytesSerialized = newCounter("bytes-serialized")
   val bytesDeserialized = newCounter("bytes-deserialized")
   val maxRecordSizeBytes = newGauge("max-record-size-bytes", 0L)
+  val record_key_size_percentiles = java.util.Arrays.asList[java.lang.Double](10D, 50D, 90D, 99D)
+  val record_value_size_percentiles = java.util.Arrays.asList[java.lang.Double](10D, 50D, 90D, 99D)
+  val recordKeySizeBytes = newHistogram("key-size-bytes-histogram",record_key_size_percentiles )
+  val recordValueSizeBytes = newHistogram("value-size-bytes-histogram", record_value_size_percentiles)

timeline.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText:
Is this only for testing?
In that case you can make it package-private and use @VisibleForTesting flag.
timeline.author: rmatharu

replies.bodyText: I deleted this method and used a MetricsVisitor instead.
replies.author: xiefan46

timeline.author: mynameborat

timeline.bodyText: any reason behind the choice of the percentiles? Especially 10th percentile?
timeline.author: mynameborat
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,6 +35,25 @@ class SerializedKeyValueStoreMetrics(
   val bytesSerialized = newCounter("bytes-serialized")
   val bytesDeserialized = newCounter("bytes-deserialized")
   val maxRecordSizeBytes = newGauge("max-record-size-bytes", 0L)
+  val record_key_size_percentiles = java.util.Arrays.asList[java.lang.Double](10D, 50D, 90D, 99D)

replies.bodyText:
+1,
50, 90, 99 maybe good enough? or 999 in addition perhaps.
replies.author: rmatharu

timeline.bodyText:
Can you explain what we achieve here by shuffling keys and values? They are already random during generation and it is not clear what is this additional shuffle for.
Simple and crisp tests are more maintainable.
timeline.author: mynameborat

replies.bodyText: At the beginning I didn't use a random way to generate keys and values so I had to shuffle them. I forgot to delete the shuffle code later on. I modified the test case and deleted them now.
replies.author: xiefan46

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer to use explicit name checks here since the goal of the test is to check for key and value size histogram. We don't want this test to fail or pass for incorrect reasons when we add a new histogram for store whose name happens to contain size-bytes-histogram
timeline.author: mynameborat

timeline.bodyText: With our builds already taking too long, do we know how long this test runs? Can we do away with something lower instead of 1000? same for the max length inside random string generation.
timeline.author: mynameborat

replies.bodyText: Use 300 instead of 1000 in this for loop and also reduce the max length of random string to 100. This test takes less than 1s now.
replies.author: xiefan46

timeline.bodyText: Is there a way we can roll together recording maximum record size into the histogram tracking? When I implemented the metric for recording max I had considered modifying histogram to record maximum in addition to percentiles, but decided against it since the memory footprint of the histogram was unjustifiable at the time. Now that we'd like those metrics anyway, maybe it is justifiable now.
timeline.author: bkonold
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -62,7 +62,10 @@ class SerializedKeyValueStore[K, V](
     val keyBytes = toBytesOrNull(key, keySerde)
     val valBytes = toBytesOrNull(value, msgSerde)
     store.put(keyBytes, valBytes)
+    val keySizeBytes = if (keyBytes == null) 0 else keyBytes.length
     val valSizeBytes = if (valBytes == null) 0 else valBytes.length
+    metrics.recordKeySizeBytes.update(keySizeBytes)
+    metrics.recordValueSizeBytes.update(valSizeBytes)
     updatePutMetrics(1, valSizeBytes)

replies.bodyText: I thought about that before. But maybe there are some people using the maximum record size metric and deleting it may caused some trouble. So I choose to keep this metric and do not combine it with the histogram.
replies.author: xiefan46

replies.bodyText: I see. We wouldn't be able to preserve the name if we emitted a maximum metric from the histogram?
replies.author: bkonold

replies.bodyText: I am not very sure about that because I am not very familiar with the code yet. I will keep that in mind and try to optimize it in the future if possible.
replies.author: xiefan46

timeline.author: mynameborat
